title: Healer/SLASH'EM
data:
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

| [ ]## Contents* [1 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the **Healer** is one of the [roles](/wiki/Role "Role") from *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that is available to the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero").

Healers can be [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), or [hobbits](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)"), and are always [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral").

## Starting equipment

Each Healer starts with the following equipment:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- a +1 [scalpel](/wiki/Scalpel "Scalpel") ([wielded](/wiki/Wielded "Wielded"))
- an uncursed +1 pair of [leather gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves")
- 10-20 uncursed [apples](/wiki/Apple "Apple")
- a blessed [spellbook of healing](/wiki/Spellbook_of_healing "Spellbook of healing")
- a blessed [spellbook of stone to flesh](/wiki/Spellbook_of_stone_to_flesh "Spellbook of stone to flesh")
- 4 non-cursed [potions of healing](/wiki/Potions_of_healing "Potions of healing")
- 4 non-cursed [potions of extra healing](/wiki/Potions_of_extra_healing "Potions of extra healing")
- [wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep") (4-8 charges)
- [wand of healing](/wiki/Wand_of_healing "Wand of healing")
- an uncursed [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope")
- an uncursed [oil lamp](/wiki/Oil_lamp "Oil lamp") (1⁄5 chance or 20%)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
- an uncursed [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker") (1⁄5 chance or 20%)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- an uncursed [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold") (1⁄5 chance or 20%)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Healers start with additional knowledge of the following items and their appearances:

- Several potions[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

  - The [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness")
  - The [potion of blindness](/wiki/Potion_of_blindness "Potion of blindness")
  - The [potion of hallucination](/wiki/Potion_of_hallucination "Potion of hallucination")
  - The [potion of restore ability](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability")
  - The [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing")

- the [healthstone](/wiki/Healthstone "Healthstone")[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

The Healer's default starting [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a [little dog](/wiki/Little_dog "Little dog") or [kitten](/wiki/Kitten "Kitten") with equal probability.

## Intrinsics

Healers gain the following intrinsic [properties](/wiki/Properties "Properties") upon reaching the given [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

- Level 1: [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- Level 15: [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")

## Attributes

The Healers's starting [attributes](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute") are distributed as follows:[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

| Attributes                 | [Strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") | [Dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") | [Constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") | [Intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence") | [Wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom") | [Charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") | Remaining |
| -------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | --------- |
| Minimum attributes         | 7                                     | 7                                        | 11                                                | 7                                                 | 13                              | 16                                    | 14        |
| Distribution percentages   | 15%                                   | 15%                                      | 25%                                               | 20%                                               | 20%                             | 5%                                    |           |
| Mean w/ standard deviation | 18/01.61±2.48                         | 13.19±2.16                               | 16.43±1.76                                        | 8.90±1.40                                         | 9.21±1.49                       | 7.90±1.40                             |           |

## Skills

Healers have the following [skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill") available to them:[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

| Healer skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max           | [Skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Basic         | - *Weapons:* [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding"), [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")
- *Spells:* [attack](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Attack_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [divination](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Divination_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [enchantment](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Enchantment_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [protection](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Protection_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)"), [body](/wiki/Body_spells "Body spells"), [matter](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Matter_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)") |
| Skilled       | * *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [paddle](/wiki/Paddle "Paddle"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| Expert        | - *Weapons:* [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- *Spells:* [healing](/wiki/Spellcasting_\(SLASH%27EM\)#Healing_spells "Spellcasting (SLASH'EM)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |

Healers start with *Basic* skill in knives and healing spells. They use the wisdom stat to cast spells, and their [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [cure sickness](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cure_sickness "Spellbook of cure sickness").[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

## Techniques

Healers can learn the [disarm](/wiki/Disarm "Disarm") [technique](/wiki/Technique "Technique") by reaching Skilled in any weapon, and also gain the following techniques:[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

|           |                                                                                                                                |
| --------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Level** | **Technique**                                                                                                                  |
| 1         | [Surgery](/wiki/Surgery "Surgery")                                                                                             |
| 20        | [Revive (technique)](/index.php?title=Revive_\(technique\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Revive (technique) (page does not exist)") |

## Special rules

Healers get a +1 [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") bonus for healing [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet").[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)

Healers do not suffer damage or [attribute](/wiki/Attribute "Attribute") loss from quaffing a [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness"), though doing so will still cure [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination").[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)

[Nurses](/wiki/Nurse "Nurse") will not damage Healers with their attacks.[\[16\]](#cite_note-16)

A Healer can more reliably apply a stethoscope to themselves while [engulfed](/wiki/Engulfed "Engulfed") by a [whirly](/wiki/Whirly "Whirly") monster.[\[17\]](#cite_note-17)

Healers can reliably apply medical kits to consume pills, and always gain their beneficial effects.[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)[\[19\]](#cite_note-19)

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:[\[20\]](#cite_note-20)

- XL 1-2: Rhizotomist
- XL 3-5: Empiric
- XL 6-9: Embalmer
- XL 10-13: Dresser
- XL 14-17: Medicus ossium/Medica ossium
- XL 18-21: Herbalist
- XL 22-25: Magister/Magistra
- XL 26-29: Physician
- XL 30: Chirurgeon

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

The Healer pantheon is based on [the mythology of ancient Greece](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_mythology "wikipedia:Greek mythology").[\[21\]](#cite_note-21)

- Lawful: [Athena](/wiki/Athena "Athena")
- Neutral: [Hermes](/wiki/Hermes "Hermes")
- Chaotic: [Poseidon](/wiki/Poseidon "Poseidon")

## Quest

- *Main article: [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest")*

The Healer's [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees them fighting the [Cyclops](/wiki/Cyclops "Cyclops") for [The Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Aesculapius "The Staff of Aesculapius"), an artifact [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"). It grants hungerless [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") while [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield"), and deals [double damage](/wiki/Double_damage "Double damage") to all monsters without [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") and drains levels from them on each hit - this life-draining applies a further +1d8 damage to the target's current and maximum HP, and restores half of that damage to the wielder's current HP. [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") The Staff of Aesculapius heals the user by half of the HP needed to return to full health, and cures [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness"), [blindness](/wiki/Blindness "Blindness") not caused by gunk (e.g. from a [cream pie](/wiki/Cream_pie "Cream pie")) and [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming").

## Strategy

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Detail to match the layout of other NetHack/SLASH'EM role strategy sections and distinguish it from those."*

## References

Healer/SLASH'EM

From NetHackWiki
< Healer
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Contents

  • 1 Starting equipment
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Attributes
  • 4 Skills
  • 5 Techniques
  • 6 Special rules
  • 7 Rank titles
  • 8 Gods
  • 9 Quest
  • 10 Strategy
  • 11 References

In SLASH'EM, the Healer is one of the roles from NetHack that is available to the hero.

Healers can be humans, gnomes, elves, or hobbits, and are always neutral.

Starting equipment

Each Healer starts with the following equipment:[1]

  • a +1 scalpel (wielded)
  • an uncursed +1 pair of leather gloves
  • 10-20 uncursed apples
  • a blessed spellbook of healing
  • a blessed spellbook of stone to flesh
  • 4 non-cursed potions of healing
  • 4 non-cursed potions of extra healing
  • wand of sleep (4-8 charges)
  • wand of healing
  • an uncursed stethoscope
  • an uncursed oil lamp (1⁄5 chance or 20%)[2]
  • an uncursed magic marker (1⁄5 chance or 20%)[3]
  • an uncursed blindfold (1⁄5 chance or 20%)[4]

Healers start with additional knowledge of the following items and their appearances:

  • Several potions[5]
    • The potion of sickness
    • The potion of blindness
    • The potion of hallucination
    • The potion of restore ability
    • The potion of full healing
  • the healthstone[6]

The Healer's default starting pet is a little dog or kitten with equal probability.

Intrinsics

Healers gain the following intrinsic properties upon reaching the given experience levels:[7]

  • Level 1: poison resistance
  • Level 15: warning

Attributes

The Healers's starting attributes are distributed as follows:[8]

Attributes Strength Dexterity Constitution Intelligence Wisdom Charisma Remaining
Minimum attributes 7 7 11 7 13 16 14
Distribution percentages 15% 15% 25% 20% 20% 5%
Mean w/ standard deviation 18/01.61±2.48 13.19±2.16 16.43±1.76 8.90±1.40 9.21±1.49 7.90±1.40

Skills

Healers have the following skills available to them:[9]

Healer skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: scimitar, saber, mace, polearms, spear, javelin, trident
  • Combat: riding, bare hands
  • Spells: attack, divination, enchantment, protection, body, matter
Skilled
  • Weapons: dagger, short sword, club, paddle, sling, shuriken
Expert
  • Weapons: knife, quarterstaff, dart, unicorn horn
  • Spells: healing

Healers start with Basic skill in knives and healing spells. They use the wisdom stat to cast spells, and their special spell is cure sickness.[10]

Techniques

Healers can learn the disarm technique by reaching Skilled in any weapon, and also gain the following techniques:[11]

Level Technique
1 Surgery
20 Revive (technique)

Special rules

Healers get a +1 alignment record bonus for healing pets.[12]

Healers do not suffer damage or attribute loss from quaffing a potion of sickness, though doing so will still cure hallucination.[13][14][15]

Nurses will not damage Healers with their attacks.[16]

A Healer can more reliably apply a stethoscope to themselves while engulfed by a whirly monster.[17]

Healers can reliably apply medical kits to consume pills, and always gain their beneficial effects.[18][19]

Rank titles

The status line displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:[20]

  • XL 1-2: Rhizotomist
  • XL 3-5: Empiric
  • XL 6-9: Embalmer
  • XL 10-13: Dresser
  • XL 14-17: Medicus ossium/Medica ossium
  • XL 18-21: Herbalist
  • XL 22-25: Magister/Magistra
  • XL 26-29: Physician
  • XL 30: Chirurgeon

Gods

Main article: Religion

The Healer pantheon is based on the mythology of ancient Greece.[21]

  • Lawful: Athena
  • Neutral: Hermes
  • Chaotic: Poseidon

Quest

Main article: Healer quest

The Healer's quest sees them fighting the Cyclops for The Staff of Aesculapius, an artifact quarterstaff. It grants hungerless regeneration while wielded, and deals double damage to all monsters without drain resistance and drains levels from them on each hit - this life-draining applies a further +1d8 damage to the target's current and maximum HP, and restores half of that damage to the wielder's current HP. Invoking The Staff of Aesculapius heals the user by half of the HP needed to return to full health, and cures sickness, blindness not caused by gunk (e.g. from a cream pie) and sliming.

Strategy

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Detail to match the layout of other NetHack/SLASH'EM role strategy sections and distinguish it from those."

rawPage:
{{tocright}}
In [[SLASH'EM]], the '''Healer''' is one of the [[role]]s from ''[[NetHack]]'' that is available to the [[hero]].

Healers can be [[Human (starting race)|humans]], [[Gnome (starting race)|gnomes]], [[Elf (starting race)|elves]], or [[Hobbit (starting race)|hobbits]], and are always [[neutral]].

==Starting equipment==
Each Healer starts with the following equipment:{{refsrc|u_init.c|75|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

* a +1 [[scalpel]] ([[wielded]])
* an uncursed +1 pair of [[leather gloves]]
* 10-20 uncursed [[apple]]s
* a blessed [[spellbook of healing]]
* a blessed [[spellbook of stone to flesh]]
* 4 non-cursed [[potions of healing]]
* 4 non-cursed [[potions of extra healing]]
* [[wand of sleep]] (4-8 charges)
* [[wand of healing]]
* an uncursed [[stethoscope]]
* an uncursed [[oil lamp]] ({{frac|5}} chance or 20%){{refsrc|u_init.c|1081|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
* an uncursed [[magic marker]] ({{frac|5}} chance or 20%){{refsrc|u_init.c|1082|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
* an uncursed [[blindfold]] ({{frac|5}} chance or 20%){{refsrc|u_init.c|1083|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Healers start with additional knowledge of the following items and their appearances:

* Several potions{{refsrc|u_init.c|1074|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
** The [[potion of sickness]]
** The [[potion of blindness]]
** The [[potion of hallucination]]
** The [[potion of restore ability]]
** The [[potion of full healing]]
* the [[healthstone]]{{refsrc|u_init.c|1080|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

The Healer's default starting [[pet]] is a [[little dog]] or [[kitten]] with equal probability.

==Intrinsics==
Healers gain the following intrinsic [[properties]] upon reaching the given [[experience level]]s:{{refsrc|attrib.c|47|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

* Level 1: [[poison resistance]]
* Level 15: [[warning]]

==Attributes==
The Healers's starting [[attribute]]s are distributed as follows:{{refsrc|role.c|166|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2|comment=Hea attributes and distributions}}

{| class="prettytable"
!| Attributes || [[Strength]] ||  [[Dexterity]] || [[Constitution]] ||[[Intelligence]] || [[Wisdom]] || [[Charisma]] || Remaining
|-
| Minimum attributes         || 7 || 7 || 11 || 7 || 13 || 16 || 14
|-
| Distribution percentages   || 15% || 15% || 25% || 20%  || 20%  || 5% || 
|-
| Mean w/ standard deviation || 18/01.61±2.48 || 13.19±2.16 || 16.43±1.76 || 8.90±1.40 || 9.21±1.49 || 7.90±1.40 
|}

==Skills==
Healers have the following [[skill]]s available to them:{{refsrc|u_init.c|1450|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}
{{Healer skill table (SLASH'EM)}}

Healers start with ''Basic'' skill in knives and healing spells. They use the wisdom stat to cast spells, and their [[special spell]] is {{+ of|cure sickness}}.{{refsrc|role.c|172|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

==Techniques==
Healers can learn the [[disarm]] [[technique]] by reaching Skilled in any weapon, and also gain the following techniques:{{refsrc|tech.c|100|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

{|class="prettytable"
|'''Level'''
|'''Technique'''
|-
|1
|[[Surgery]]
|-
|20
|[[Revive (technique)]]
|}

==Special rules==
Healers get a +1 [[alignment record]] bonus for healing [[pet]]s.{{refsrc|zap.c|346|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Healers do not suffer damage or [[attribute]] loss from quaffing a [[potion of sickness]], though doing so will still cure [[hallucination]].{{refsrc|potion.c|725|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|potion.c|734|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|potion.c|1555|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

[[Nurse]]s will not damage Healers with their attacks.{{refsrc|mhitu.c|1750|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

A Healer can more reliably apply a stethoscope to themselves while [[engulfed]] by a [[whirly]] monster.{{refsrc|apply.c|216|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Healers can reliably apply medical kits to consume pills, and always gain their beneficial effects.{{refsrc|apply.c|3660|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}{{refsrc|apply.c|3694|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

==Rank titles==
The [[status line]] displays one of the following ranks for the corresponding experience levels:{{refsrc|role.c|145|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

*XL 1-2: Rhizotomist
*XL 3-5: Empiric
*XL 6-9: Embalmer
*XL 10-13: Dresser
*XL 14-17: Medicus ossium/Medica ossium
*XL 18-21: Herbalist
*XL 22-25: Magister/Magistra
*XL 26-29: Physician
*XL 30: Chirurgeon

==Gods==
{{main|Religion}}
The Healer pantheon is based on [[Wikipedia:Greek mythology|the mythology of ancient Greece]].{{refsrc|role.c|155|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

* Lawful: [[Athena]]
* Neutral: [[Hermes]]
* Chaotic: [[Poseidon]]

==Quest==
{{main|Healer quest}}
The Healer's [[quest]] sees them fighting the [[Cyclops]] for [[The Staff of Aesculapius]], an artifact [[quarterstaff]]. It grants hungerless [[regeneration]] while [[wield]]ed, and deals [[double damage]] to all monsters without [[drain resistance]] and drains levels from them on each hit - this life-draining applies a further +1d8 damage to the target's current and maximum HP, and restores half of that damage to the wielder's current HP. [[Invoking]] The Staff of Aesculapius heals the user by half of the HP needed to return to full health, and cures [[sickness]], [[blindness]] not caused by gunk (e.g. from a [[cream pie]]) and [[sliming]].
